Reviews.Title: “Memphis in May - amazing stay!”
Reviews.Author: ChiCity88
Reviews.Content: Was visiting for Memphis in May. The hotel was def packed, however, the staff was able to handle it pretty well. The indoor pool was cool you can tell they've been maintaining it. Staff was incredibly helpful. We were with some children and the floor got a little noisy at night. Wife called the front desk and staff was able to regulate within a few minutes. The best part was how close it was to the highway. For the price we paid for this place we had no complaints.

Reviews.Title: “nice indoor pool.....”
Reviews.Author: traveler5234
Reviews.Content: pretty nice place. right off I-40. front desk was nice and helpful. bed was comfortable. pretty decent breakfast in the morning. no complaints from me.

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful experience overall- friendly staff and courteous service!”
Reviews.Author: riri86
Reviews.Content: When I arrived at the sleep in, the staff was extremely helpful and I was checked into my room in no time at all. When I got to my room, it was very clean and well kept and definitely is a great bargain. I had a pleasant experience overall. The staff was quick to answer and very helpful. I would recommend the Sleep in and will stay here whenever I am in the area.

Reviews.Title: “They Just Don't Care”
Reviews.Author: TheWanderer972
Reviews.Content: I'm a member of the Choice Hotels rewards program and stay at many of their hotels. However, after this experience I will NOT stay at a Sleep Inn again. Of the 7 hotels we stayed in on a recent 10 day vacation, this was by far the worst. We booked reservations from the road 3 hours before arrival. Our rooms were hot and musty smelling. The air conditioners were turned off and apparently had been for many days. We left the property for dinner so our rooms could cool off. There was trash in the hallway and the floors looked as if they hadn't seen a vacuum cleaner in weeks. While eating their lame excuse for breakfast the next morning we watched another couple wait for almost 15 minutes for someone to come to the front desk so they could checkout. This was 8 am in the morning and there was NO ONE at the front desk. When we attempted to checkout 30 minutes later we had to wait 10 minutes. No apologies were given. The management of this property simply doesn't care. They don't care about their customers. They don't care about service. They don't have any concept of professionalism. Stay anywhere but here!

Reviews.Title: “Do NOT stay here!”
Reviews.Author: skc082104
Reviews.Content: This was the worst hotel experience we have ever had. My family and I stayed there for two nights. Unfortunately, someone in my extended family chose this location. Just after checking in, we decided to check out the pool. It was small, musty and the smell of dead chlorine was over-whelming. No way was I going to put my infant in there! Then we head up stairs, which was on a non-smoking floor. That rule was, obviously, never enforced. In my parents room, the shower door was broken and barely hanging on the hinges. Their alarm clock was flashing and we couldn't get it to stop. Our room was off the chart awful! Our sheets had cigarette burns. Our daughter's sheets had lipstick stains. Our alarm clock was broken, too. Our shower had a hole in the side of it AND I walk in to find my husband not alone in the shower...there was a baby ROACH in there with him!!! Other fun experiences...the police were called to break up a physical fight in the parking lot. Our car alarm was set off the first night. Our hall mates loved their music loud and their bass high. They also liked to party in the hallway, which is probably why the hallway smelled so smokey. There were multiple power outages, at least 6 and there was not a storm in the area. And to top it all of, my husband is a graduate student and needed the internet, but of course it was down. After numerous phone calls to the front desk and their IT provider, the problem was never resolved. We took pictures for all the other TripAdvisor lovers out there! Go to Memphis, but please, do NOT stay here!

Reviews.Title: “Good place to stay”
Reviews.Author: teechur
Reviews.Content: Most Sleep Inns are the same design. A cozy room, a small frig, a microwave, free wi-fi, nice showers. This one is a bit off the main I-40 freeway, but easy to find. At the light intersection past it, you could go a few blocks and find some restaurants and stores. This seems to be a quiet place. The only negative was that the maid had forgotten to put any bath toiletries out, but since I bring my own, that didn't matter much. (I could have gotten them from the front desk if I wanted). Sleep Inns are not a romantic get-a-way type of place, but good for travelers and families (especially with free continental breakfast at them all).

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: wishiwasinthevi
Reviews.Content: We checked into an econo lodge and promptly checked back out due to the horrible conditions of the hotel. We stayed at this Sleep Inn and it was great! The rooms were comfortable and clean, the staff was great and the location was wonderful. I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Awful Experience”
Reviews.Author: j3fromcali
Reviews.Content: Only one pro: The hotel was easy to find. Cons: The non-smoking floor smelled musty, moldy and rank. The walls are VERY thin. The light in shower was broken. The management didn't do anything about the rowdy, drunk college kids who were loud and obnoxious at 4 in the morning. Empty beer bottles were overflowing in the trash can at the front door - what a great first impression! The management didn't ask how our stay was. The sign in the bathroom that said, 'save our planet...' didn't mean a damn thing, as our towels that were hung on the rack (as requested) and new-barely used soaps were replaced everyday. Don't go there. The place sucked.

Reviews.Title: “Hated it”
Reviews.Author: BeachBabe1966
Reviews.Content: We had infants with us, but they had no rooms in the whole hotel with a tub to bathe them in. Had to settle for a shower. Sliding door separating bathroom and sleeping area did not close completely, so no privacy while showering, using the toilet, etc. Felt unsafe in this part of Memphis. Would not stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Not a good experience”
Reviews.Author: Travelopolis
Reviews.Content: If you want a cheap place to sleep and don't mind smelly rooms trash-strewn hallways scant complimentary breakfasts a sketchy neighborhood dirty sheets and pillow cases clueless front-desk staff and a 15 minute drive without traffic into downtown its not a bad place. It was comforting that the safe in the room worked.

Reviews.Title: “absolutely terrible!!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband and I, along with his father, booked two rooms for three nights not knowing what we were getting oursellves into! Having never been to Memphis before and having a good track record staying in Sleep Inns we figured that we would have no problems occur during our stay. How wrong we were!! Pros: Close to interstate, fairly helpful staff. Cons: Bad area in Memphis, hotel falling apart after only three years, rooms smell terrible, sheets stained and dirty, bathroom door didn't close, television damaged, shower light burnt out, noise level at night out of control, trash in hallways, pool out of order, continental breakfast a joke. In closing, I would not recommend this hotel to anyone, even to my worst enemies. The experience was scary and no one could pay me enough to stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This 2 star hotel was more than a 2 star i felt like i was in one of the most expensive hotels in memphis Tn. When I arrived I found no Roaches, Rats, etc. The hotel met all of my accomidations. The Pool was very clean but let me give you some advice don't stay at days inn hotels becuase the pool and serivce is terrible anyway I liked the hotel Very much. I would recommend this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty good overall, but the surrounding area is a little run down”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: It was a good place to stay without the draining the wallet. If a run down surrounding area is not a big deal to you, then this is a great place to stay. It's just off the interstate, but there's not much in terms of restaurants in the area.

Reviews.Title: “Family Emergency Prevented Stay - Mgr. Won't return Calls”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We had reserved two rooms, one for my wife and I and one for a couple traveling with us. About an hour before we were to arrive in Memphis, we recevied and urgent phone call that our son had a medical emergency which would require us to turn around and go to Nashville immediately. We phoned the Sleep Inn to cancel our rooms but were told that we must cancel 24 hours prior to our expected arrival. We explained that we had just learned of our son's medical emergency and had no way to notify them 24 hours prior. We asked to speak with the manager Mike Patel but were told he wasn't available. We call back the following Monday and Tuesday and each time were told that the manager wasn't in. We left our phone number and asked him to return our call. He never called back and we were charged for both rooms.

Reviews.Title: “A pleasant stay.”
Reviews.Author: RickyTutt
Reviews.Content: My wife & 7 others in our party stayed in this hotel which is a very pleasant place to stop if you are in Memphis, it is nice & clean & the rooms are done every day with new sheets on the bed, the beds are very big there must have been at least a foot and a half between me & the misses, there was a TV but there was only a couple of channels worth watching, the Memphis news to keep up with info about the main highway into Memphis, & the American film channel (Ch 43) it was the monsterfest when we went horror films from morning until night,there is a inside pool & a restaurant which serves a continental style breakfast, of which you help yourself to, the hotel is a bit of a drive into town & the main highway ringroad around Memphis which is shared by 2 roads, the top half is I-40 & the bottom half is I-240 which is a bit confusing at first & the times we took a wrong turn of it is to many to mention,this hotel is very nice but i think if we visit Memphis again we will book a hotel close to the centre.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad for the price”
Reviews.Author: scruffygirl
Reviews.Content: My husband and I chose to stay at this hotel because we were in Memphis for a business-related purpose and weren't there to sight-see much or for leisure. We got a good deal via the website for Choice hotels and overall the room was satisfactory. Pros: Large, clean whirlpool tub; large bathroom; nice HOT water; Microfridge; convenient to highway; helpful front desk; good value; decent breakfast. Cons: cleanliness slighty suspect (was that mascara on my pillowcase); not the best location; tub leaked into carpet in corner of room on the last night; I gave this hotel an above average rating because of the value for money and friendly staff.

HotelInfo.Name: Sleep Inn - Memphis / Old Austin Peay Hwy
HotelInfo.Address: 2855 Old Austin Peay Hwy, Memphis, TN 38128-5604
